organizations: Southern New Hampshire University in Manchester

thread.title: Clinton emails: Obama aides knew of private address
thread.title_full: Clinton emails: Obama aides knew of private address

title: Clinton emails: Obama aides knew of private address
text:
The Clintons on defense Washington (CNN) President Barack Obama's top aides, including David Axelrod , communicated with Hillary Clinton at her private email address while she was secretary of state, new records show. Her use of private email was out of step with the State Department's rules against employees regularly using personal email for work purposes. And Obama officials -- including Axelrod -- had denied knowing that Clinton wasn't using a government email address. He told MSNBC this month that he would have asked questions about it if he'd been aware of her email habits. News of Clinton's use of a private email address on a personal server in her New York home broke this year as she prepared to launch her campaign for the 2016 presidential nomination. The State Department posted to its website just before 9 p.m. Tuesday the latest batch of Clinton's emails from her time in office -- this time, 1,925 separate emails totaling more than 3,000 pages, all from 2009. It's a fraction of the 55,000 pages of emails Clinton turned over to State for processing. The department is releasing the documents in sets monthly, under a U.S. District Court ruling, after they're reviewed and with some information redacted. RELATED: State Dept: Clinton did not turn over some emails The emails reveal some details about who was in Clinton's personal orbit. Sidney Blumenthal, a friend who sent policy emails, appeared, with Clinton bringing his name up with staffers. So did Strobe Talbott, a diplomat and Clinton friend since the 1970s. At one point, Clinton asked Talbott to have lunch or dinner and talk policy. In another email, she asked him to recommend a smart young assistant. Among the White House staffers who emailed Clinton was Axelrod, Obama's image guru, who reached out after Clinton injured her elbow in a fall in the State Department parking lot. "You are an all-star player, and we need you for the long run!" he wrote, without mentioning Clinton's use of a private address. Clinton turned on the charm, saying she was honored to serve Obama and asking for "one-on-one" time with Axelrod "just comparing notes and catching up in the next weeks." Many of the emails made public on Tuesday covered mundane tasks -- like Clinton's struggles to use a fax machine, her musings about what's for lunch or dinner and her staff wondering who handled its "Twittering." Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, pictured here on Tuesday, March 3, has become one of the most powerful people in Washington. Here's a look at her life and career through the years. Hide Caption 1 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Before she married Bill Clinton, she was Hillary Rodham. Here, Rodham talks about student protests in 1969, which she supported in her commencement speech at Wellesley College in Wellesley, Massachusetts. Hide Caption 2 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Rodham, center, a lawyer for the Rodino Committee, and John Doar, left, chief counsel for the committee, bring impeachment charges against President Richard Nixon in the Judiciary Committee hearing room at the U.S. Capitol in 1974. Hide Caption 3 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Arkansas Gov. Bill Clinton helps first lady Rosalynn Carter on a campaign swing through Arkansas in June 1979. Also seen in the photo is Hillary Clinton, center background. Hide Caption 4 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Bill Clinton embraces his wife shortly after a stage light fell near her on January 26, 1992. They talk to Don Hewitt, producer of the CBS show "60 Minutes." Hide Caption 5 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos With Hillary, Democratic presidential candidate Bill Clinton waves to the crowd at his victory party after winning the Illinois primary on March 17, 1992. Hide Caption 6 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Al Gore, Tipper Gore, Bill Clinton and Hillary Clinton wave to supporters at the Chautauqua Institution in Chautauqua, New York, after they gave speeches on family values on August 23, 1992. Hide Caption 7 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton gestures at a campaign rally November 3, 1992, in Denver. After taking office, President Clinton chose his wife to head a special commission on health care reform, the most significant public policy initiative of his first year in office. Hide Caption Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Bill and Hillary Clinton have a laugh together on Capitol Hill in 1993. Hide Caption 9 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton pours herself a cup of tea in 1993 while testifying to the Senate Education and Labor Committee about health care reform. Hide Caption 10 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton speaks at George Washington University on September 10, 1993, in Washington during her husband's first term. Hide Caption 11 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton waves to the media on January 26, 1996, as she arrives at federal court in Washington for an appearance before a grand jury. The first lady was subpoenaed to testify as a witness in the investigation of the Whitewater land deal in Arkansas. Hide Caption 12 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Hillary Clinton looks on as President Clinton discusses the Monica Lewinsky scandal in the Roosevelt Room of the White House on January 26, 1998. Hide Caption 13 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Hillary and Bill Clinton arrive at Foundry United Methodist Church on August 16, 1998, in Washington. He became the first sitting president to testify before a grand jury when he testified via satellite about the Lewinsky matter. Hide Caption 14 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton shakes hands during a St. Patrick's Day parade in the Sunnyside neighborhood of Queens, New York, on March 5, 2000. Hide Caption 15 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton waves to the crowd as she arrives on the stage at the Democratic National Convention on August 14, 2000, in Los Angeles. Hide Caption 16 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton campaigns for a Senate seat October 25, 2000, at Grand Central Station in New York. Hide Caption 17 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Hillary Clinton is sworn in as a senator of New York in a re-enactment ceremony with, from left, President Clinton, nephew Tyler, daughter Chelsea, brother Hugh Rodham, mother Dorothy Rodham and Vice President Al Gore on January 3, 2001, in Washington. Hide Caption 18 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Andrew Cuomo, Eliot Spitzer and Clinton celebrate with a crowd of Democratic supporters after their wins in various races November 7, 2006, in New York. Hide Caption 19 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton speaks during a post-primary rally on January 8, 2007, at Southern New Hampshire University in Manchester, New Hampshire. Hide Caption 20 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos The Clintons pay a visit to the 92nd annual Hopkinton State Fair in Contoocook, New Hampshire, on September 2, 2007. Hide Caption 21 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton speaks at a campaign rally September 2, 2007, in Portsmouth, New Hampshire. She was running for the Democratic presidential nomination. Hide Caption 22 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton addresses a question during a debate with other Democratic presidential candidate at Dartmouth College in Hanover, New Hampshire, on September 26, 2007. Also pictured are U.S. Rep. Dennis Kucinich of Ohio, left, and former U.S. Sen. Mike Gravel of Alaska. Hide Caption 23 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Felipe Bravo, left, and Christian Caraballo are covered with Hillary Clinton stickers in downtown Manchester, New Hampshire, on January 8, 2008. Hide Caption 24 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton campaigns in Council Bluffs, Iowa, with her daughter, Chelsea, on January 1, 2008, two days ahead of the January 3 state caucus. Hide Caption 25 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton waves as she speaks to supporters at the National Building Museum on June 7, 2008, in Washington. After pulling out of the presidential race, Clinton thanked her supporters and urged them to back Barack Obama to be the next president of the United States. Hide Caption 26 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Obama and Clinton talk on the plane on their way to a Unity Rally in Unity, New Hampshire, on June 27, 2008. Hide Caption 27 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Obama watches Clinton address the Democratic National Convention on August 26, 2008. The two endured a long, heated contest for the 2008 nomination. Hide Caption 28 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Sen. Charles Schumer, left, looks toward Secretary of State designate Clinton as Senate Foreign Relations Committee chairman Sen. John Kerry, center, looks on during nomination hearings January 13, 2009, on Capitol Hill. Hide Caption 29 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton testifies during her confirmation hearing for secretary of state on January 13, 2009, in Washington. Hide Caption 30 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton, as secretary of state, dances with a local choir while visiting the Victoria Mxenge Housing Project in Philippi, a township on the outskirts of Cape Town, South Africa, on August 8, 2009. Hide Caption 31 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton looks through binoculars toward North Korea during a visit to an observation post July 21, 2010, at the demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas. Hide Caption 32 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton walks up the steps to her aircraft as she leaves a meeting of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations on July 23, 2010, in Hanoi, Vietnam. Hide Caption 33 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Hillary and Bill Clinton pose on the day of their daughter's wedding to Marc Mezvinsky on July 31, 2010, in Rhinebeck, New York. Hide Caption 34 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos U.S. President Barack Obama and Clinton observe a moment of silence before a NATO meeting November 19, 2010, in Lisbon, Portugal. Hide Caption 35 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton listens as Turkish Foreign Minister Ahmet Davutoglu makes a brief statement November 29, 2010, before a bilateral meeting at the State Department in Washington. Hide Caption 36 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton shakes hands with a child during an unannounced walk through Tahrir Square in Cairo on March 16, 2011. Hide Caption 37 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Obama, Vice President Joe Biden, Clinton and members of Obama's national security team receive an update on the Osama bin Laden mission May 1, 2011, in the Situation Room of the White House. Hide Caption Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton checks her personal digital assistant prior to departing Malta on October 18, 2011. Hide Caption Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton dances while in Cartagena, Colombia, on April 15, 2012. Hide Caption Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton enjoys a beer at Cafe Havana in Cartagena, Colombia, on April 15, 2012. Hide Caption 41 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton appears with little makeup during an event in Dhaka, Bangladesh, on May 6, 2012. She tells CNN, "I feel so relieved to be at the stage I'm at in my life right now ... Because you know if I want to wear my glasses, I'm wearing my glasses. If I want to wear my hair back I'm pulling my hair back. You know at some point it's just not something that deserves a lot of time and attention." Hide Caption 42 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton speaks as Afghanistan President Hamid Karzai listens during a news conference at the presidential palace in Kabul, Afghanistan, on July 7, 2012. Hide Caption Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton arrives at Ben Gurion International Airport in Israel on July 15, 2012. Hide Caption 44 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton looks on as Obama makes a statement in response to the attack at the U.S. Consulate in Libya on September 12, 2012. Hide Caption 45 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton applauds Myanmar opposition leader Aung San Suu Kyi during a ceremony where Suu Kyi was presented with the Congressional Gold Medal on September 19, 2012. Hide Caption 46 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Bill Clinton kisses his wife after introducing her at the Clinton Global Initiative annual meeting on September 24, 2012, in New York City. Hide Caption 47 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton shakes hands with Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge, while attending a reception with Prince William, second from right, in New York in December. Hide Caption 48 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Clinton speaks to reporters at U.N. headquarters on Tuesday, March 10, addressing her use of private email for official work as secretary of state. She said she used a private domain out of "convenience" but admitted in retrospect "it would have been better" to use multiple emails. Hide Caption 49 of 50 Hillary Clinton's career in the spotlight 50 photos Democratic presidential candidate, former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton gestures before speaking to supporters Saturday, June 13 on Roosevelt Island in New York, in a speech promoted as her formal presidential campaign debut. Hide Caption 50 of 50 A number of prominent Democrats also appeared in Clinton's emails. She corresponded with Jimmy Carter about whether he would go to North Korea to secure the release of two journalists who were imprisoned there -- a trip Bill Clinton ended up making. She heard from Democratic Sen. Barbara Mikulski of Maryland, who said Clinton's former female Senate colleagues wished her well. Mikulski also offered that the so-called public option, which was being debated as part of Obama's health care law, seemed as if it was being drawn up "on back of envelope." After her elbow injury, Clinton also heard from John Podesta , who is now the chairman of her presidential campaign. He wrote: "Tried you a couple days ago, but email bounced back Neera [Tanden] says this is the right one. How are you doing? Hope it's not too excruciating, but suspect that it is. Hope you're better soon. We need you in the real majors." Clinton and her closest staffers, including long-time aide Huma Abedin, also communicated in a sort of code, using nicknames. In one email, Clinton wrote: " I'm seeing Santa at 8:30 so won't take off until closer to 9:30. Is that ok?" One conversation Clinton apparently wasn't looking forward to having was with her husband's vice president, Al Gore . Abedin wrote in a May 18 email's subject line: "Gore just called saying he hasn't heard from you. he's expecting to hear from you tonite. I'm sorry." CNN's Jeff Zeleny, Elise Labott, Stephen Collinson, Dan Merica and Rachel Streitfeld contributed to this report.
Politics Originals Story by Stephen Collinson and video by Ashley Codianni It wouldn't be the first time a revolution sparked in New England changed the world.
